title: Sampling Distribution Facts
question_text:
Which of the statements is/are true concerning sampling distributions?

I. Larger sample sizes have a sampling distribution with more variability. II. Larger sample sizes have a sampling distribution that becomes closer to a normal in shape, but only if the parent population is normal. III. Poor sampling methods could result in a sampling distribution centered away from the true population mean.
solution:
Statement I is incorrect; larger samples have a sampling distribution with less variability.
Statement II is incorrect; larger samples have a sampling distribution closer to normal no matter what the shape of the parent population is; this is a consequence of the central limit theorem.

Statement III is correct; poor sampling methods will result in bias where the mean of the sampling distribution may not be the same as the population mean.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
